page.title: 15BOOTHBY SCHOOL IN THE 1920'S
page.content: He lived in Boothby Pagnell 1923-1937.There was one little school in Boothby and two teachers at this school.One teacher for the infants who were aged between 5-7.The other teacher was for the juniors who were aged between 7-14.At school it started at 9o'clock and finished at 4o'clock.The children left school at the age of 14 always.Grandad used to get up at 6o'clock in the morning and went to bed straight after tea.He had to go over 4 fields to get to school.They had no free milk at school.They used to take some sandwiches for dinner,because they had to far to go home for dinner.They had a coal fire at school.When a young boy, he used to bring a piece of bread to school and toast it by the coal fire.
